statements: SELECT * FROM employee_data WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT full_name, role FROM employee_data WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT contact_number FROM employee_data WHERE employee_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM employee_data WHERE role = 'Developer' ORDER BY full_name DESC;
SELECT employee_id, full_name, contact_number FROM employee_data WHERE contact_number LIKE '%123%' ORDER BY full_name ASC;
SELECT full_name, role FROM employee_data WHERE employee_id = 10
SELECT * FROM employee_data WHERE role = 'Manager' ORDER BY full_name DESC
SELECT employee_id, full_name, contact_number FROM employee_data WHERE role = 'Analyst' ORDER BY employee_id ASC
SELECT full_name, contact_number FROM employee_data WHERE role = 'Developer' AND employee_id between 5 and 10
SELECT employee_id, full_name, role, contact_number FROM employee_data
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE id = 1;
SELECT role_name FROM roles WHERE role_id > 3 ORDER BY role_name DESC;
SELECT name, contact_info FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT id, name, role, contact_info FROM employees ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, name, role, contact_info FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE name='John Doe' AND role='Developer';
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE id=3;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role='Manager' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT e.name, r.role_name FROM employees e JOIN roles r ON e.role = r.role_name;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, role FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_name, contact_info FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM departments WHERE manager_id IS NOT NULL;
SELECT task_id, task_description, due_date FROM tasks WHERE due_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_name, contact_info FROM employees WHERE employee_id = 1;
SELECT department_name, manager_id FROM departments ORDER BY department_name DESC;
SELECT task_description, due_date FROM tasks WHERE assigned_to = 2 ORDER BY due_date ASC;
SELECT employee_name, department_name, role FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.employee_id = departments.manager_id ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';
SELECT employee_id, employee_name FROM employees ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT department_name, location FROM departments WHERE location='New York';
SELECT role_title, salary FROM roles WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT employee_name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';
SELECT e.employee_name, r.role_title, r.salary FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.employee_id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id;

SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name, d.location FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.employee_id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id JOIN departments d ON d.department_id = e.employee_id WHERE r.salary > 50000;

SELECT e.employee_name, e.contact_number, r.role_title FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_roles er ON e.employee_id = er.employee_id LEFT JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.role_id WHERE e.employee_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT id, name FROM departments WHERE id > 3;
SELECT * FROM roles ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT e.name as employee_name, d.name as department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.id = d.id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT name, contact_info FROM employees WHERE role = 'Employee' AND id > 100 ORDER BY name DESC;

SELECT e.name, r.name AS role_name, d.name AS department_name FROM employees e JOIN employee_roles er ON e.id = er.employee_id JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.id JOIN employee_department ed ON e.id = ed.employee_id JOIN departments d ON ed.department_id = d.id WHERE r.name = 'Engineer' AND d.id = 3;

SELECT e.name, d.name AS department_name, COUNT(er.role_id) AS role_count FROM employees e JOIN employee_department ed ON e.id = ed.employee_id JOIN departments d ON ed.department_id = d.id JOIN employee_roles er ON e.id = er.employee_id GROUP BY e.name, d.name HAVING role_count > 1 ORDER BY role_count DESC;

SELECT e.name, r.name AS role_name, d.name AS department_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_roles er ON e.id = er.employee_id LEFT JOIN roles r ON er.role_id = r.id LEFT JOIN employee_department ed ON e.id = ed.employee_id LEFT JOIN departments d ON ed.department_id = d.id WHERE r.name IS NULL OR d.id IS NULL;
